title: Re: Yes:
content:
No, what's the fun in that?! I can't jump! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-offended.gif[/img]

Never really thought exactly 17 metres, but high jumps would be neat. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-pogo.gif[/img] Eat your veggies!

title: Lucid
content:
I just wish I could launch myself a couple of metres into the air and swim through it as if it was an ocean, like I do in my dreams. 17 metres would be nice too, though, but only if it was a Keenish jump with a controlled descent and no fall damage.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Lucid
content:
I've never wished that; I've always wanted to jump exactly 5.5m high, 17 carries too much risk; firstly, everyone can see you up there and will ask questions, secondly, bones will brake, thirdly you'd always be hitting your head, fourthly, 17 is unlucky.

title: Re: Lucid
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr](...) swim through it as if it was an ocean, like I do in my dreams.[hr][/quote]

It's funny how everybody I speak that mentions dreaming about flying, describes swimming in the air.
Then again the running but feeling like the air is made out of bubble gum so you are hold back, and discovering you are naked in public (although I personally don't dream that often, and if I do I always discover before I head out in public luckily) are equally common, so it's probably simply something in the human brain that causes it.

Anyway, jumping that height would be nice I think.
Maybe if you believe you can, or rather if you don't know you can't, you're actually able to do it.
Ignorance is bliss!Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Or...
content:
I have this really anoying thing following me around everywhere I go.
It usually manages to place itself right under my feet.
If I push it off very suddenly, it moves away from me and I'ml free for a while, but within no time the thing races towards my feet again.
I can make it rotate underneath me by moving my legs sequentially, which is kind of nice.
It seems to be some kind of ball-shaped object with a surface filled with interesting and not so interesting stuff.
There are even some people living on it, which can be fun every now and again.
Still, I wish I could push it away hard enough to get rid of it sometimes.
Oh well!Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]
